name: Sprite Lamp - Dynamic lighting for 2D art
blurb: Sprite Lamp is a tool to help game developers combine 2D art, such as digital painting or pixel art, with dynamic lighting.

rewards.reward: You have my thanks. Apart from the much-appreciated financial support, more supporters helps make the case to developers that this kind of visual style is something gamers want. This pledge is a vote toward that kind of game!

Beta access to (what will eventually be) the free version of Sprite lamp. That means you can do everything but save assets for in-game use. You can play around with map generation, view things in the preview window, and export an animated GIF to preview the lighting; you just can't export the actual normal/depth/etc maps.

Early bird price: You get the Hobbyist version of Sprite Lamp when it becomes available, for a platform of your choice (plus a Steam key, should Sprite Lamp become available on Steam). You also get in on the beta of Sprite Lamp, which starts shortly after the Kickstarter concludes. While unpolished and missing a few features, it's what was used to generate all the images and animated GIFs on this Kickstarter.

Kickstarter price: You get the Hobbyist version of Sprite Lamp when it becomes available, for a platform of your choice (plus a Steam key, should Sprite Lamp become available on Steam). You also get in on the beta of Sprite Lamp, which starts shortly after the Kickstarter concludes. While unpolished and missing a few features, it's what was used to generate all the images and animated GIFs on this Kickstarter.

Hobbyist version of Sprite Lamp, beta access, plus I'll put some artwork you make with Sprite Lamp on a special Sponsor's Gallery that I'll link from the Sprite Lamp website. This will include a link to your game's website (or whatever relevant website you choose). I reserve the right to only include safe-for-work artwork and links in this gallery.

Early bird price: You get the pro version of Sprite Lamp when it becomes available, for a platform of your choice, as well as a Steam key if we make it to Steam. You also get beta access, which happens shortly after the conclusion of this Kickstarter campaign. The pro version adds generation of anisotropy maps, in-preview animation viewing, the ability to load custom shaders in the preview window, and the ability to process batches of images from the command line.

Kickstarter price: You get the pro version of Sprite Lamp when it becomes available, for a platform of your choice, as well as a Steam key if we make it to Steam. You also get beta access, which happens shortly after the conclusion of this Kickstarter campaign. The pro version adds generation of anisotropy maps, in-preview animation viewing, the ability to load custom shaders in the preview window, and the ability to process batches of images from the command line.

Pro version of Sprite Lamp, beta access, plus I'll put some artwork you make with Sprite Lamp on a special Sponsor's Gallery that I'll link from the Sprite Lamp website. This will include a link to your game's website (or whatever relevant website you choose). I reserve the right to only include safe-for-work artwork and links in this gallery.
Studio pack: You get five copies of the pro version of Sprite Lamp, for slightly less than five times the price of the single version. You also get a spot in the Sponsor's Gallery.

You apparently really want this project to happen, and I really appreciate it! I'm not famous or cool enough to offer any of those 'come to the launch party' type rewards, but what I can offer is ten copies of the pro version of Sprite Lamp, your name in the credits under "extremely awesome person" or similar (even if you're actually kind of a jerk), a space in the Sponsor's Gallery, and my eternal undying thanks. If I ever see you at a conference or something, you will get *the highest* of fives.
